definition: irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: This likeness unquestionably included the ability to engage in intelligible speech via human language.
sentences.chinese: 这种相似性无可非议地包括使用人类的语言的能力。

sentences.english: From my point of view, Fan's behavior of the escaping first itself is above exception.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，范美忠先跑的行为本身是无可非议的。

sentences.english: The intellectual sources for these prejudices are, however, impeccable.
sentences.chinese: 这些学术偏见的根源倒也无可非议。
他的作为是无可非议的。

sentences.english: It is all very well for such tings to occur in fiction.
sentences.chinese: 这种事发生在小说中是无可非议的。

sentences.english: His manners are beyond reproach. everyone owns his right to live his life.
sentences.chinese: 他的举止是无可非议人人都拥有自己生活的权利。

definition: see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
not to be censured too strictly (idiom)/not altogether inexcusable/understandable
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
